workflow.name: Automate Shopify abandoned cart WhatsApp reminders with product links via Rapiwa
workflow.description:
# Automate Shopify Abandoned Cart WhatsApp Reminders with Product Links via Rapiwa

## Who‚Äôs it for
This n8n workflow automatically identifies customers who have abandoned their carts on your Shopify store, cleans and verifies their WhatsApp numbers, and sends them personalized reminders via the Rapiwa API. It also logs each interaction‚Äîwhether the number was valid or not‚Äîinto a connected Google Sheet. Designed for marketers, small business owners, freelancers, and support teams, this solution makes it easy to run bulk WhatsApp campaigns using just a Google Sheet and your own WhatsApp number‚Äîno need for the official WhatsApp Business API. It‚Äôs a budget-friendly, scalable, and easy-to-manage alternative for anyone looking to automate WhatsApp follow-ups without the tech hassle.

## How it Works / What It Does
- Reads rows from a Google Sheet where the Status column is marked as "pending".
- Cleans each phone number (removes special characters, spaces, etc.).
- Verifies whether the number is a WhatsApp user using the Rapiwa API.
- If valid:
  - Sends the message via Rapiwa.
  - Updates Status = sent and Verification = verified.
- If invalid:
  - Skips sending.
  - Updates Status = not sent and Verification = unverified.
- Waits a configurable delay between sends to avoid rate limits.
- Processes rows in small batches and repeats on schedule (default every 5 minutes).

---

## How to Set Up
1. Duplicate the sample Google Sheet format and populate it with contacts and messages.
2. Fill required columns such as WhatsApp No, Name, Message, Image URL, and set Status = pending.
3. Connect Google Sheets in n8n and grant the required OAuth scopes.
4. Create an HTTP Bearer credential in n8n and paste your Rapiwa API key.
5. Configure the workflow nodes (Trigger, Google Sheets, Limit, SplitInBatches, Code, HTTP Request, If, Update Google Sheets, Wait).
6. Enable the workflow in n8n.

---

## Requirements
- Google Sheets API credentials (OAuth2) configured in n8n
- Google Sheet matching the template (WhatsApp No, Name, Message, Status, Verification)
- Rapiwa account and Bearer token
- n8n instance with HTTP Request and Google Sheets nodes enabled

---

## How to Customize the Workflow
- Add or increase delay between messages using the Wait node (e.g., 5‚Äì10 seconds).
- Change message content or include media by editing the HTTP Request body.
- Personalize messages using sheet columns (Name, product details, coupon codes).
- Add error handling nodes to retry failed sends or log errors.
- Adjust the Limit node to control how many rows are processed per run.

---

## Workflow Highlights
- Triggered every 5 minutes using the Schedule Trigger node.
- Filters sheet rows where Status = pending.
- Cleans numbers and verifies WhatsApp existence before sending.
- Sends messages via Rapiwa (unofficial API).
- Updates Google Sheet rows with Status = sent/not sent and Verification = verified/unverified.
- Uses a Wait node to prevent rapid-fire sending.

---

## Setup in n8n

### 1. Connect Google Sheets
- Add a Google Sheets node.
- Authenticate with your Google account.
- Select the document and worksheet.
- Use a filter or query to fetch rows with `Status = pending`.

### 2. Loop Through Rows
- Use SplitInBatches to process rows in small chunks (e.g., 5 rows per batch).
- Add a Code node to clean phone numbers (remove non-digits).
- Add a Wait node to pause between individual sends (recommended 5 seconds).

### 3. Send Message via HTTP Node
- Configure an HTTP Request node to POST to:
  `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message`
- Use Bearer Token authentication with your Rapiwa API key.
- Example JSON body:
```
{
  "number": "{{ $json['WhatsApp No'] }}",
  "message": "{{ $json['Message'] }}"
}
```
- After the send, update the row in Google Sheets with the result.

---

## Sample Google Sheet Structure
 - A Google Sheet formatted like this ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1zsVzniJTeiFOafCI_V0B3_7VnlAPQ2CTWQa-N30qCqs/edit?usp=sharing)

| name | number | order id | item name | coupon | item link | total price | validity | status |
| -------------- | ------------- | -------------- | --------------------------------- | ------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ---------- | -------- |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801400620056 | 39248398811454 | S25 Ultra 5XXXXX Price Cell Phone | | [Product Link](https://your-shop-domain.myshopify.com/946181xxxxxx&locale=en-BD) | 11500.00 BDT | unverified | not sent |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801400620055 | 39248402153790 | S25 Ultra 5XXXXX Price Cell Phone | | [Product Link](https://your-shop-domain.myshopify.com/946181xxxxxx&locale=en-BD) | 11500.00 BDT | verified | sent |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801400620055 | 39248403431742 | S25 Ultra 5XXXXX Price Cell Phone | | [Product Link](https://your-shop-domain.myshopify.com/946181xxxxxx&locale=en-BD) | 11500.00 BDT | verified | sent |

---

## Tips
- Ensure numbers are in proper format (e.g., 8801XXXXXXXXX ‚Äî no +, no spaces).
- Use public image URLs if sending media.
- Store Rapiwa API key securely in n8n credentials.
- Test with a small batch before scaling up.
- Mark processed rows as "sent" to avoid duplicates.
- Increase Wait time or reduce batch size if you encounter rate limiting.

## Important Notes
- Avoid Duplicates: The Google Sheet serves as a ledger. Sent messages won‚Äôt be repeated in the next cycle.
- Rate Limit Awareness: Use Wait nodes to space out requests and avoid getting banned.
- Add Delay for Safety: If needed, increase wait times or limit message batches.
- Extendable: You can add product images, links, or even abandon cart discounts dynamically.

## Future Enhancements (Ideas)
- Add delay between batches (e.g., 60 messages/hour)
- Auto-update Shopify checkout status (via GraphQL API)
- Use more advanced templates or media (via Rapiwa)
- Add error handling to log failed API calls
- Use Telegram/Slack node to notify when process ends
---

## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)

## Support
- WhatsApp Support: [Chat Now](https://wa.me/8801322827799)  
- Discord: [Join SpaGreen Community](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)  
- Facebook Group: [SpaGreen Support](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)  
- Website: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)  
- Developer Portfolio: [Codecanyon SpaGreen](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

workflow.name: Automate Shopify Abandoned Cart WhatsApp Reminders with Product Links via Rapiwa

parameters.name: message

nodes.name: Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa1

parameters.content:
## Clean and Verify WhatsApp Numbers
Before sending messages, each WhatsApp number is cleaned (removing spaces and symbols) and checked to make sure it‚Äôs a real, active WhatsApp account. Only valid numbers will get a message, so you don‚Äôt waste time or credits.

- **Node:** Clean WhatsApp Number

**Purpose:** Removes extra characters (like spaces, dashes, or parentheses) from the phone number.

**Why it's important:** WhatsApp only accepts clean numeric formats. This step avoids delivery errors.

- **Node:** Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa
  - Checks if the WhatsApp number is real and can receive messages.
  - Only valid numbers will get a message.

## Conditional Logic

The **If** node checks whether `data.exists == true`:

- **True branch (verified):**
  - Sends a WhatsApp confirmation via Rapiwa.
  - Appends to Google Sheets with validity: verified.

- **False branch (unverified):**
  - Appends data to the sheet with validity: unverified.

## Send Message via HTTP Request Using Rapiwa

**Purpose:** Sends the actual message via the Rapiwa API.

**How it works:** Makes a POST request to `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message` with:
- `number`: Cleaned WhatsApp number  
- `message`: The text from the sheet

**Why it's important:** This is the core of the automation ‚Äî it connects your message to WhatsApp via Rapiwa.



## Change State of Rows in Sent
**Why it's important:** So you don‚Äôt accidentally resend the same message in the next cycle. Keeps track of what‚Äôs already done.

Two separate Google Sheets nodes:
- **Verified append row in sheet** ‚Äì for valid numbers.
- **Unverified append row in sheet** ‚Äì for invalid numbers.
- **A Google Sheet** formatted like this ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1zsVzniJTeiFOafCI_V0B3_7VnlAPQ2CTWQa-N30qCqs/edit?usp=sharing)

## Append Unverified Row to Sheet
This node is triggered after a phone number is checked and found to be **unverified**. It appends the form submission data to the Google Sheet with the field `validity` set to `"unverified"`.

This node appends data to a Google Sheet when a WhatsApp number is **unverified**.
- **A Google Sheet** formatted like this ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1zsVzniJTeiFOafCI_V0B3_7VnlAPQ2CTWQa-N30qCqs/edit?usp=sharing)  


## Wait

**Purpose:** Pauses for a few seconds (e.g., 5 sec) before sending the next message.

**Why it's important:** Prevents sending too many messages too quickly, which could get your WhatsApp number flagged or blocked.

nodes.name: Change State of Rows in Verified & Sent

parameters.content:
# Automate Shopify Abandoned Cart WhatsApp Reminders with Product Links via Rapiwa

## Overview
This n8n workflow automatically identifies customers who have abandoned their carts on your Shopify store, cleans and verifies their WhatsApp numbers, and sends them personalized reminders via the Rapiwa API. It also logs each interaction‚Äîwhether the number was valid or not‚Äîinto a connected Google Sheet. Designed for marketers, small business owners, freelancers, and support teams, this solution makes it easy to run bulk WhatsApp campaigns using just a Google Sheet and your own WhatsApp number‚Äîno need for the official WhatsApp Business API. It‚Äôs a budget-friendly, scalable, and easy-to-manage alternative for anyone looking to automate WhatsApp follow-ups without the tech hassle.

## Features
- Fetches abandoned checkouts from Shopify
- Cleans phone numbers to WhatsApp-ready format
- Verifies if the number is registered on WhatsApp using Rapiwa
- Sends customized cart recovery WhatsApp messages
- Logs status (sent/not sent) and validity (verified/unverified) in Google Sheets
- Batches messages to avoid API rate limits or number bans
- Automatically loops with a scheduler
- Fully customizable messages and structure

## Requirements
- A Shopify store with abandoned checkouts
- Rapiwa API access with Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials set up in n8n
- WhatsApp number linked and authorized in Rapiwa
- Google Sheet structured like this: sample sheet

## Workflow Logic Breakdown
1. Scheduled Trigger  
   - Node: Schedule Trigger  
   - What it does: Runs automatically based on a scheduled interval (e.g., every few hours).  
   - Why it matters: Ensures the automation works in the background without manual input.

2. Fetch Abandoned Checkouts  
   - Node: HTTP Request  
   - Endpoint: `https://salebotsg.myshopify.com/admin/api/2025-07/checkouts.json`  
   - Auth: Shopify private app token via HTTP Header Auth  
   - What it does: Pulls all active abandoned checkouts from Shopify.  
   - Why it matters: It's the data source for your WhatsApp reminders.

3. Format the API Response  
   - Node: Format HTTP Response Data (Code Node)  
   - What it does: Extracts customer name, phone, product title, quantity, price, and checkout URL from the raw JSON response.  
   - Why it matters: Structures data for clean downstream use.

4. Loop Through Each Checkout  
   - Node: Loop Over Items (SplitInBatches)  
   - What it does: Processes one checkout at a time.  
   - Why it matters: Enables batching and individual handling.

5. Clean WhatsApp Numbers  
   - Node: Clean WhatsApp Number (Code Node)  
   - What it does: Strips all non-numeric characters from the phone number.  
   - Why it matters: WhatsApp requires properly formatted numbers.

6. Check if Number is WhatsApp-Valid  
   - Node: Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa1  
   - API Endpoint: `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/verify-whatsapp`  
   - Method: POST  
   - What it does: Validates if the number is active on WhatsApp.  
   - Why it matters: Saves API credits and avoids errors by skipping invalid numbers.

7. Conditional Logic  
   - Node: If  
   - Condition: `data.exists == true`  
   - What it does: Branches based on WhatsApp validity.  
     - True: Number is valid, send message and log as verified.  
     - False: Number is invalid, skip sending and log as unverified.

### If Number Is Verified

8. Send WhatsApp Message via Rapiwa  
   - Node: Rapiwa Sender  
   - API Endpoint: `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message`  
   - Method: POST  
   - Auth: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE  
   - Message Template:

```
Hi {{ customerName }},

You left items in your cart at SpaGreen Creative. Here‚Äôs a quick look:

Order Details:
‚Ä¢ Product: {{ productTitle }}
‚Ä¢ Qty: {{ quantity }}
‚Ä¢ Total: {{ totalPrice }} {{ presentment_currency }}

Use code SPAGREEN10 for 10% OFF at checkout!

Complete your order: {{ abandonedCheckoutURL }}

Hurry ‚Äî your cart won‚Äôt wait forever!

‚Äî Team SpaGreen Creative
```

9. Log Verified + Sent  
   - Node: Change State of Rows in Verified & Sent  
   - What it does: Appends row to Google Sheet with:
     - `status: sent`
     - `validity: verified`  
   - Why it matters: Helps keep a record and prevent re-sending.

If Number Is Not Verified

10. Log Unverified + Not Sent  
    - Node: Change State of Rows in Unverified & Not Sent  
    - What it does: Appends row to Google Sheet with:
      - `status: not sent`
      - `validity: unverified`  
    - Why it matters: Logs failed entries for review and debugging.

11. Wait Between Messages  
    - Node: Wait  
    - What it does: Pauses (e.g., 5 seconds) between each cycle.  
    - Why it matters: Prevents Rapiwa from flagging or blocking your number.
    - A Google Sheet formatted like this ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1zsVzniJTeiFOafCI_V0B3_7VnlAPQ2CTWQa-N30qCqs/edit?usp=sharing)

| name            | number        | order id       | item name   | coupon | item link      | total price     | validity   | status   |
|-----------------|---------------|----------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------|-------------------------------------------|
| Golam Rabbi     | 8801758152474 | 39248398811454 | S25 Ultra 5XXXXX Price Cell Phone |        | https://salebotsg.myshopify.com/946181xxxxxx&locale=en-BD | 11500.00 BDT     | unverified | not sent |
| Shakil Ahammed  | 8801322827753 | 39248402153790 | S25 Ultra 5XXXXX Price Cell Phone |        | https://salebotsg.myshopify.com/946181xxxxxx&locale=en-BD | 11500.00 BDT     | verified   | sent     |
| Shakil Ahammed  | 8801322827753 | 39248403431742 | S25 Ultra 5XXXXX Price Cell Phone |        | https://salebotsg.myshopify.com/946181xxxxxx&locale=en-BD | 11500.00 BDT     | verified   | sent     |

## Scheduled Trigger  
- What it does: Runs automatically based on a scheduled interval (e.g., every few hours).  
- Why it matters: Ensures the automation works in the background without manual input.

## Fetch Abandoned Checkouts  
### Node: HTTP Request  
   - Endpoint: `https://salebotsg.myshopify.com/admin/api/2025-07/checkouts.json`  
   - Auth: Shopify private app token via HTTP Header Auth  
   - What it does: Pulls all active abandoned checkouts from Shopify.  
   - Why it matters: It's the data source for your WhatsApp reminders.

## Format the API Response  
### Node: Format HTTP Response Data (Code Node)  
   - What it does: Extracts customer name, phone, product title, quantity, price, and checkout URL from the raw JSON response.  
   - Why it matters: Structures data for clean downstream use.

## Loop Through Each Checkout  
### Node: Loop Over Items (SplitInBatches)  
   - What it does: Processes one checkout at a time.  
   - Why it matters: Enables batching and individual handling.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
